text: Florac Trois Rivières is a French commune, a subprefecture of the Lozère department, in the Occitanie region. It is also the capital of the arrondissement of Florac. The municipality was established on 1 January 2016 when the former communes of Florac and La Salle-Prunet were combined to form the new commune. ==Geography== Florac Trois Rivières is in the valley of the Tarnon river, a small river that flows through the Lozère department before joining the Tarn river. The commune is found at the start of the Gorges du Tarn (a canyon formed by the Tarn river). The city and the Tarnon valley are within the Cévennes National Park but they are not part of the park. The commune of Florac Trois Rivières has an area of and its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . Florac Trois Rivières and its neighboring communes The commune is surrounded by the communes Quézac, Bédouès-Cocurès, Pont de Montvert - Sud Mont Lozère, Cans et Cévennes, Vebron and Montbrun. The climate in Florac Trois Rivières in the Köppen climate classification is Cfb - Oceanic climate with template summers. ==Population== , Florac Trois Rivières had 2,107 inhabitants for a density of persons/km2. The inhabitants of this city are known, in French, as Floracois (women: Floracoises). ==Twinned and partner towns== Florac Trois Rivières is twinned with: * L'Anse-Saint-Jean, Quebec, Canada * Arbúcies, Catalonia, Spain ==Gallery== FR-48-Florac10.JPG|Florac City hall FR-48-Florac02.JPG|Protestant temple, Florac Florac-St Martin chevet.jpg|Saint-Martin church France Lozère Florac Château 5.jpg|Florac castle ==Related pages== * Arrondissement of Florac * Communes of the Lozère department ==References== ==Other websites== * Mairie de Florac Trois Rivières website Category:2016 establishments in France Category:Subprefectures in France Category:Communes in Lozère
